Famciclovir is active against HSV-1, HSV-2, and VZV, and, to a lesser extent, against EBV. Its mechanism of action is through penciclovir; penciclovir triphosphate inhibits herpes DNA synthesis by acting as a substrate for viral DNA polymerase. The major clinical indications for famciclovir use are treatment of herpes zoster, recurrent genital herpes,
52 and recurrent herpes labialis.
53 Famciclovir can also be used as suppression therapy to reduce the risk of recurrent genital herpes as well as oral treatment of uncomplicated varicella in HIV-infected patients.
